namespace.name: tinymce
namespace.description: Root level namespace this contains classes directly releated to the TinyMCE editor.

class.name: AddOnManager
class.summary: This class handles the loading of themes/plugins or other add-ons and their language packs.
class.description: This class handles the loading of themes/plugins or other add-ons and their language packs.

event.name: onAdd
event.summary: Fires when a item is added.
event.description: Fires when a item is added.

method.name: get
method.summary: Returns the specified add on by the short name.
method.description: Returns the specified add on by the short name.

param.name: n
param.description: Add-on to look for.

return.description: Theme or plugin add-on instance or undefined.

method.name: requireLangPack
method.summary: Loads a language pack for the specified add-on.
method.description: Loads a language pack for the specified add-on.

param.name: n
param.description: Short name of the add-on.

method.name: add
method.summary: Adds a instance of the add-on by it's short name.
method.description: Adds a instance of the add-on by it's short name.

param.name: id
param.description: Short name/id for the add-on.

param.name: o
param.description: Theme or plugin to add.

return.description: The same theme or plugin instance that got passed in.

method.name: load
method.summary: Loads an add-on from a specific url.
method.description: Loads an add-on from a specific url.

param.name: n
param.description: Short name of the add-on that gets loaded.

param.name: u
param.description: URL to the add-on that will get loaded.

param.name: cb
param.description: Optional callback to execute ones the add-on is loaded.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional scope to execute the callback in.

class.name: Theme
class.summary: TinyMCE theme class.
class.description: TinyMCE theme class.

method.name: init
method.summary: Initializes the theme.
method.description: Initializes the theme.

param.name: editor
param.description: Editor instance that created the theme instance.

param.name: url
param.description: Absolute URL where the theme is located.

method.name: getInfo
method.summary: Meta info method, this method gets executed when TinyMCE wants to present information about the theme for example in the...
method.description: Meta info method, this method gets executed when TinyMCE wants to present information about the theme for example in the about/help dialog.

return.description: Returns an object with meta information about the theme the current items are longname, author, authorurl, infourl and version.

method.name: renderUI
method.summary: This method is responsible for rendering/generating the overall user interface with toolbars, buttons, iframe containers...
method.description: This method is responsible for rendering/generating the overall user interface with toolbars, buttons, iframe containers etc.

param.name: obj
param.description: Object parameter containing the targetNode DOM node that will be replaced visually with an editor instance.

return.description: an object with items like iframeContainer, editorContainer, sizeContainer, deltaWidth, deltaHeight.

class.name: Plugin
class.summary: Plugin base class, this is a pseudo class that describes how a plugin is to be created for TinyMCE.
class.description: Plugin base class, this is a pseudo class that describes how a plugin is to be created for TinyMCE. The methods below are all optional.

method.name: init
method.summary: Initialization function for the plugin.
method.description: Initialization function for the plugin. This will be called when the plugin is created.

param.name: editor
param.description: Editor instance that created the plugin instance.

param.name: url
param.description: Absolute URL where the plugin is located.

method.name: getInfo
method.summary: Meta info method, this method gets executed when TinyMCE wants to present information about the plugin for example in th...
method.description: Meta info method, this method gets executed when TinyMCE wants to present information about the plugin for example in the about/help dialog.

return.description: Returns an object with meta information about the plugin the current items are longname, author, authorurl, infourl and version.

method.name: createControl
method.summary: Gets called when a new control instance is created.
method.description: Gets called when a new control instance is created.

param.name: name
param.description: Control name to create for example "mylistbox"

param.name: controlman
param.description: Control manager/factory to use to create the control.

return.description: Returns a new control instance or null.

class.name: ControlManager
class.summary: This class is responsible for managing UI control instances.
class.description: This class is responsible for managing UI control instances. It's both a factory and a collection for the controls.

method.name: ControlManager
method.summary: Constructs a new control manager instance.
method.description: Constructs a new control manager instance. Consult the Wiki for more details on this class.

param.name: ed
param.description: TinyMCE editor instance to add the control to.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional settings object for the control manager.

method.name: get
method.summary: Returns a control by id or undefined it it wasn't found.
method.description: Returns a control by id or undefined it it wasn't found.

param.name: id
param.description: Control instance name.

return.description: Control instance or undefined.

method.name: setActive
method.summary: Sets the active state of a control by id.
method.description: Sets the active state of a control by id.

param.name: id
param.description: Control id to set state on.

param.name: s
param.description: Active state true/false.

return.description: Control instance that got activated or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: setDisabled
method.summary: Sets the dsiabled state of a control by id.
method.description: Sets the dsiabled state of a control by id.

param.name: id
param.description: Control id to set state on.

param.name: s
param.description: Active state true/false.

return.description: Control instance that got disabled or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: add
method.summary: Adds a control to the control collection inside the manager.
method.description: Adds a control to the control collection inside the manager.

param.name: Control
param.description: instance to add to collection.

return.description: Control instance that got passed in.

method.name: createControl
method.summary: Creates a control by name, when a control is created it will automatically add it to the control collection.
method.description: Creates a control by name, when a control is created it will automatically add it to the control collection. It first ask all plugins for the specified control if the plugins didn't return a control then the default behavior will be used.

param.name: n
param.description: Control name to create for example "separator".

return.description: Control instance that got created and added.

method.name: createDropMenu
method.summary: Creates a drop menu control instance by id.
method.description: Creates a drop menu control instance by id.

param.name: id
param.description: Unique id for the new dropdown instance. For example "some menu".

param.name: s
param.description: Optional settings object for the control.

param.name: cc
param.description: Optional control class to use instead of the default one.

return.description: Control instance that got created and added.

method.name: createListBox
method.summary: Creates a list box control instance by id.
method.description: Creates a list box control instance by id. A list box is either a native select element or a DOM/JS based list box control. This depends on the use_native_selects settings state.

param.name: id
param.description: Unique id for the new listbox instance. For example "styles".

param.name: s
param.description: Optional settings object for the control.

param.name: cc
param.description: Optional control class to use instead of the default one.

return.description: Control instance that got created and added.

method.name: createButton
method.summary: Creates a button control instance by id.
method.description: Creates a button control instance by id.

param.name: id
param.description: Unique id for the new button instance. For example "bold".

param.name: s
param.description: Optional settings object for the control.

param.name: cc
param.description: Optional control class to use instead of the default one.

return.description: Control instance that got created and added.

method.name: createMenuButton
method.summary: Creates a menu button control instance by id.
method.description: Creates a menu button control instance by id.

param.name: id
param.description: Unique id for the new menu button instance. For example "menu1".

param.name: s
param.description: Optional settings object for the control.

param.name: cc
param.description: Optional control class to use instead of the default one.

return.description: Control instance that got created and added.

method.name: createSplitButton
method.summary: Creates a split button control instance by id.
method.description: Creates a split button control instance by id.

param.name: id
param.description: Unique id for the new split button instance. For example "spellchecker".

param.name: s
param.description: Optional settings object for the control.

param.name: cc
param.description: Optional control class to use instead of the default one.

return.description: Control instance that got created and added.

method.name: createColorSplitButton
method.summary: Creates a color split button control instance by id.
method.description: Creates a color split button control instance by id.

param.name: id
param.description: Unique id for the new color split button instance. For example "forecolor".

param.name: s
param.description: Optional settings object for the control.

param.name: cc
param.description: Optional control class to use instead of the default one.

return.description: Control instance that got created and added.

method.name: createToolbar
method.summary: Creates a toolbar container control instance by id.
method.description: Creates a toolbar container control instance by id.

param.name: id
param.description: Unique id for the new toolbar container control instance. For example "toolbar1".

param.name: s
param.description: Optional settings object for the control.

param.name: cc
param.description: Optional control class to use instead of the default one.

return.description: Control instance that got created and added.

method.name: createSeparator
method.summary: Creates a separator control instance.
method.description: Creates a separator control instance.

param.name: cc
param.description: Optional control class to use instead of the default one.

return.description: Control instance that got created and added.

method.name: setControlType
method.summary: Overrides a specific control type with a custom class.
method.description: Overrides a specific control type with a custom class.

param.name: n
param.description: Name of the control to override for example button or dropmenu.

param.name: c
param.description: Class reference to use instead of the default one.

return.description: Same as the class reference.

method.name: destroy
method.description: Destroy.

class.name: Editor
class.summary: This class contains the core logic for a TinyMCE editor.
class.description: This class contains the core logic for a TinyMCE editor.

method.author: Moxiecode
method.name: Editor
method.summary: Constructs a editor instance by id.
method.description: Constructs a editor instance by id.

param.name: id
param.description: Unique id for the editor.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional settings string for the editor.

property.name: id
property.summary: Editor instance id, normally the same as the div/textarea that was replaced.
property.description: Editor instance id, normally the same as the div/textarea that was replaced.

property.name: isNotDirty
property.summary: State to force the editor to return false on a isDirty call.
property.description: State to force the editor to return false on a isDirty call.

property.name: plugins
property.summary: Name/Value object containting plugin instances.
property.description: Name/Value object containting plugin instances.
property.example: // Execute a method inside a plugin directly tinyMCE.activeEditor.plugins.someplugin.someMethod();

property.name: settings
property.summary: Name/value collection with editor settings.
property.description: Name/value collection with editor settings.
property.example: // Get the value of the theme setting tinyMCE.activeEditor.windowManager.alert("You are using the " + tinyMCE.activeEditor.settings.theme + " theme");

property.name: documentBaseURI
property.summary: URI object to document configured for the TinyMCE instance.
property.description: URI object to document configured for the TinyMCE instance.

property.name: baseURI
property.summary: URI object to current document that holds the TinyMCE editor instance.
property.description: URI object to current document that holds the TinyMCE editor instance.

property.name: contentCSS
property.summary: Array with CSS files to load into the iframe.
property.description: Array with CSS files to load into the iframe.

method.name: render
method.summary: Renderes the editor/adds it to the page.
method.description: Renderes the editor/adds it to the page.

property.name: windowManager
property.summary: Window manager reference, use this to open new windows and dialogs.
property.description: Window manager reference, use this to open new windows and dialogs.

method.name: init
method.summary: Initializes the editor this will be called automatically when all plugins/themes and language packs are loaded by the re...
method.description: Initializes the editor this will be called automatically when all plugins/themes and language packs are loaded by the rendered method. This method will setup the iframe and create the theme and plugin instances.

property.name: theme
property.summary: Reference to the theme instance that was used to generate the UI.
property.description: Reference to the theme instance that was used to generate the UI.
property.example: // Executes a method on the theme directly tinyMCE.activeEditor.theme.someMethod();

property.name: controlManager
property.summary: Control manager instance for the editor.
property.description: Control manager instance for the editor. Will enables you to create new UI elements and change their states etc.

method.name: setupIframe
method.summary: This method get called by the init method ones the iframe is loaded.
method.description: This method get called by the init method ones the iframe is loaded. It will fill the iframe with contents, setups DOM and selection objects for the iframe. This method should not be called directly.

property.name: schema
property.summary: Schema instance, enables you to validate elements and it's children.
property.description: Schema instance, enables you to validate elements and it's children.

property.name: dom
property.summary: DOM instance for the editor.
property.description: DOM instance for the editor.
property.example: // Adds a class to all paragraphs within the editor tinyMCE.activeEditor.dom.addClass(tinyMCE.activeEditor.dom.select('p'), 'someclass');

property.name: parser
property.summary: HTML parser will be used when contents is inserted into the editor.
property.description: HTML parser will be used when contents is inserted into the editor.

property.name: serializer
property.summary: DOM serializer for the editor.
property.description: DOM serializer for the editor. Will be used when contents is extracted from the editor.
property.example: // Serializes the first paragraph in the editor into a string tinyMCE.activeEditor.serializer.serialize(tinyMCE.activeEditor.dom.select('p')[0]);

property.name: selection
property.summary: Selection instance for the editor.
property.description: Selection instance for the editor.

property.name: formatter
property.summary: Formatter instance.
property.description: Formatter instance.

property.name: undoManager
property.summary: Undo manager instance, responsible for handling undo levels.
property.description: Undo manager instance, responsible for handling undo levels.
property.example: // Undoes the last modification to the editor tinyMCE.activeEditor.undoManager.undo();

property.name: initialized
property.summary: Is set to true after the editor instance has been initialized
property.description: Is set to true after the editor instance has been initialized

method.name: setupContentEditable
method.summary: Sets up the contentEditable mode.
method.description: Sets up the contentEditable mode.

method.name: focus
method.summary: Focuses/activates the editor.
method.description: Focuses/activates the editor. This will set this editor as the activeEditor in the tinymce collection it will also place DOM focus inside the editor.

param.name: sf
param.description: Skip DOM focus. Just set is as the active editor.

method.name: execCallback
method.summary: Executes a legacy callback.
method.description: Executes a legacy callback. This method is useful to call old 2.x option callbacks. There new event model is a better way to add callback so this method might be removed in the future.

param.name: n
param.description: Name of the callback to execute.

return.description: Return value passed from callback function.

method.name: translate
method.summary: Translates the specified string by replacing variables with language pack items it will also check if there is a key mat...
method.description: Translates the specified string by replacing variables with language pack items it will also check if there is a key mathcin the input.

param.name: s
param.description: String to translate by the language pack data.

return.description: Translated string.

method.name: getLang
method.summary: Returns a language pack item by name/key.
method.description: Returns a language pack item by name/key.

param.name: n
param.description: Name/key to get from the language pack.

param.name: dv
param.description: Optional default value to retrive.

method.name: getParam
method.summary: Returns a configuration parameter by name.
method.description: Returns a configuration parameter by name.

param.name: n
param.description: Configruation parameter to retrive.

param.name: dv
param.description: Optional default value to return.

param.name: ty
param.description: Optional type parameter.

return.description: Configuration parameter value or default value.

method.name: nodeChanged
method.summary: Distpaches out a onNodeChange event to all observers.
method.description: Distpaches out a onNodeChange event to all observers. This method should be called when you need to update the UI states or element path etc.

param.name: o
param.description: Optional object to pass along for the node changed event.

method.name: addButton
method.summary: Adds a button that later gets created by the ControlManager.
method.description: Adds a button that later gets created by the ControlManager. This is a shorter and easier method of adding buttons without the need to deal with the ControlManager directly. But it's also less powerfull if you need more control use the ControlManagers factory methods instead.

param.name: n
param.description: Button name to add.

param.name: s
param.description: Settings object with title, cmd etc.

method.name: addCommand
method.summary: Adds a custom command to the editor, you can also override existing commands with this method.
method.description: Adds a custom command to the editor, you can also override existing commands with this method. The command that you add can be executed with execCommand.

param.name: name
param.description: Command name to add/override.

param.name: callback
param.description: Function to execute when the command occurs.

param.name: scope
param.description: Optional scope to execute the function in.

callback.name: addCommandCallback
callback.summary: Callback function that gets called when a command is executed.
callback.description: Callback function that gets called when a command is executed.

param.name: ui
param.description: Display UI state true/false.

param.name: value
param.description: Optional value for command.

return.description: True/false state if the command was handled or not.

method.name: addQueryStateHandler
method.summary: Adds a custom query state command to the editor, you can also override existing commands with this method.
method.description: Adds a custom query state command to the editor, you can also override existing commands with this method. The command that you add can be executed with queryCommandState function.

param.name: name
param.description: Command name to add/override.

param.name: callback
param.description: Function to execute when the command state retrival occurs.

param.name: scope
param.description: Optional scope to execute the function in.

callback.name: addQueryStateHandlerCallback
callback.summary: Callback function that gets called when a queryCommandState is executed.
callback.description: Callback function that gets called when a queryCommandState is executed.

return.description: True/false state if the command is enabled or not like is it bold.

method.name: addQueryValueHandler
method.summary: Adds a custom query value command to the editor, you can also override existing commands with this method.
method.description: Adds a custom query value command to the editor, you can also override existing commands with this method. The command that you add can be executed with queryCommandValue function.

param.name: name
param.description: Command name to add/override.

param.name: callback
param.description: Function to execute when the command value retrival occurs.

param.name: scope
param.description: Optional scope to execute the function in.

callback.name: addQueryValueHandlerCallback
callback.summary: Callback function that gets called when a queryCommandValue is executed.
callback.description: Callback function that gets called when a queryCommandValue is executed.

return.description: Value of the command or undefined.

method.name: addShortcut
method.summary: Adds a keyboard shortcut for some command or function.
method.description: Adds a keyboard shortcut for some command or function.

param.name: pa
param.description: Shortcut pattern. Like for example: ctrl+alt+o.

param.name: desc
param.description: Text description for the command.

param.name: cmd_func
param.description: Command name string or function to execute when the key is pressed.

param.name: sc
param.description: Optional scope to execute the function in.

return.description: true/false state if the shortcut was added or not.

method.name: execCommand
method.summary: Executes a command on the current instance.
method.description: Executes a command on the current instance. These commands can be TinyMCE internal commands prefixed with "mce" or they can be build in browser commands such as "Bold". A compleate list of browser commands is available on MSDN or Mozilla.org. This function will dispatch the execCommand function on each plugin, theme or the execcommand_callback option if none of these return true it will handle the command as a internal browser command.

param.name: cmd
param.description: Command name to execute, for example mceLink or Bold.

param.name: ui
param.description: True/false state if a UI (dialog) should be presented or not.

param.name: val
param.description: Optional command value, this can be anything.

param.name: a
param.description: Optional arguments object.

return.description: True/false if the command was executed or not.

method.name: queryCommandState
method.summary: Returns a command specific state, for example if bold is enabled or not.
method.description: Returns a command specific state, for example if bold is enabled or not.

param.name: cmd
param.description: Command to query state from.

return.description: Command specific state, for example if bold is enabled or not.

method.name: queryCommandValue
method.summary: Returns a command specific value, for example the current font size.
method.description: Returns a command specific value, for example the current font size.

param.name: c
param.description: Command to query value from.

return.description: Command specific value, for example the current font size.

method.name: show
method.summary: Shows the editor and hides any textarea/div that the editor is supposed to replace.
method.description: Shows the editor and hides any textarea/div that the editor is supposed to replace.

method.name: hide
method.summary: Hides the editor and shows any textarea/div that the editor is supposed to replace.
method.description: Hides the editor and shows any textarea/div that the editor is supposed to replace.

method.name: isHidden
method.summary: Returns true/false if the editor is hidden or not.
method.description: Returns true/false if the editor is hidden or not.

return.description: True/false if the editor is hidden or not.

method.name: setProgressState
method.summary: Sets the progress state, this will display a throbber/progess for the editor.
method.description: Sets the progress state, this will display a throbber/progess for the editor. This is ideal for asycronous operations like an AJAX save call.

param.name: b
param.description: Boolean state if the progress should be shown or hidden.

param.name: ti
param.description: Optional time to wait before the progress gets shown.

param.name: o
param.description: Optional object to pass to the progress observers.

return.description: Same as the input state.

method.name: load
method.summary: Loads contents from the textarea or div element that got converted into an editor instance.
method.description: Loads contents from the textarea or div element that got converted into an editor instance. This method will move the contents from that textarea or div into the editor by using setContent so all events etc that method has will get dispatched as well.

param.name: o
param.description: Optional content object, this gets passed around through the whole load process.

return.description: HTML string that got set into the editor.

method.name: save
method.summary: Saves the contents from a editor out to the textarea or div element that got converted into an editor instance.
method.description: Saves the contents from a editor out to the textarea or div element that got converted into an editor instance. This method will move the HTML contents from the editor into that textarea or div by getContent so all events etc that method has will get dispatched as well.

param.name: o
param.description: Optional content object, this gets passed around through the whole save process.

return.description: HTML string that got set into the textarea/div.

method.name: setContent
method.summary: Sets the specified content to the editor instance, this will cleanup the content before it gets set using the different ...
method.description: Sets the specified content to the editor instance, this will cleanup the content before it gets set using the different cleanup rules options.

param.name: content
param.description: Content to set to editor, normally HTML contents but can be other formats as well.

param.name: args
param.description: Optional content object, this gets passed around through the whole set process.

return.description: HTML string that got set into the editor.

method.name: getContent
method.summary: Gets the content from the editor instance, this will cleanup the content before it gets returned using the different cle...
method.description: Gets the content from the editor instance, this will cleanup the content before it gets returned using the different cleanup rules options.

param.name: args
param.description: Optional content object, this gets passed around through the whole get process.

return.description: Cleaned content string, normally HTML contents.

method.name: isDirty
method.summary: Returns true/false if the editor is dirty or not.
method.description: Returns true/false if the editor is dirty or not. It will get dirty if the user has made modifications to the contents.

return.description: True/false if the editor is dirty or not. It will get dirty if the user has made modifications to the contents.

method.example: if (tinyMCE.activeEditor.isDirty()) alert("You must save your contents.");

method.name: getContainer
method.summary: Returns the editors container element.
method.description: Returns the editors container element. The container element wrappes in all the elements added to the page for the editor. Such as UI, iframe etc.

return.description: HTML DOM element for the editor container.

method.name: getContentAreaContainer
method.summary: Returns the editors content area container element.
method.description: Returns the editors content area container element. The this element is the one who holds the iframe or the editable element.

return.description: HTML DOM element for the editor area container.

method.name: getElement
method.summary: Returns the target element/textarea that got replaced with a TinyMCE editor instance.
method.description: Returns the target element/textarea that got replaced with a TinyMCE editor instance.

return.description: HTML DOM element for the replaced element.

method.name: getWin
method.summary: Returns the iframes window object.
method.description: Returns the iframes window object.

return.description: Iframe DOM window object.

method.name: getDoc
method.summary: Returns the iframes document object.
method.description: Returns the iframes document object.

return.description: Iframe DOM document object.

method.name: getBody
method.summary: Returns the iframes body element.
method.description: Returns the iframes body element.

return.description: Iframe body element.

method.name: convertURL
method.summary: URL converter function this gets executed each time a user adds an img, a or any other element that has a URL in it.
method.description: URL converter function this gets executed each time a user adds an img, a or any other element that has a URL in it. This will be called both by the DOM and HTML manipulation functions.

param.name: u
param.description: URL to convert.

param.name: n
param.description: Attribute name src, href etc.

param.name: Tag
param.description: name or HTML DOM element depending on HTML or DOM insert.

return.description: Converted URL string.

method.name: addVisual
method.summary: Adds visual aid for tables, anchors etc so they can be more easily edited inside the editor.
method.description: Adds visual aid for tables, anchors etc so they can be more easily edited inside the editor.

param.name: e
param.description: Optional root element to loop though to find tables etc that needs the visual aid.

method.name: remove
method.summary: Removes the editor from the dom and tinymce collection.
method.description: Removes the editor from the dom and tinymce collection.

method.name: destroy
method.summary: Destroys the editor instance by removing all events, element references or other resources that could leak memory.
method.description: Destroys the editor instance by removing all events, element references or other resources that could leak memory. This method will be called automatically when the page is unloaded but you can also call it directly if you know what you are doing.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional state if the destroy is an automatic destroy or user called one.

class.name: EditorCommands
class.summary: This class enables you to add custom editor commands and it contains overrides for native browser commands to address va...
class.description: This class enables you to add custom editor commands and it contains overrides for native browser commands to address various bugs and issues.

method.name: execCommand
method.summary: Executes the specified command.
method.description: Executes the specified command.

param.name: command
param.description: Command to execute.

param.name: ui
param.description: Optional user interface state.

param.name: value
param.description: Optional value for command.

return.description: true/false if the command was found or not.

method.name: queryCommandState
method.summary: Queries the current state for a command for example if the current selection is "bold".
method.description: Queries the current state for a command for example if the current selection is "bold".

param.name: command
param.description: Command to check the state of.

return.description: true/false if the selected contents is bold or not, -1 if it's not found.

method.name: queryCommandValue
method.summary: Queries the command value for example the current fontsize.
method.description: Queries the command value for example the current fontsize.

param.name: command
param.description: Command to check the value of.

return.description: Command value of false if it's not found.

method.name: addCommands
method.summary: Adds commands to the command collection.
method.description: Adds commands to the command collection.

param.name: command_list
param.description: Name/value collection with commands to add, the names can also be comma separated.

param.name: type
param.description: Optional type to add, defaults to exec. Can be value or state as well.

class.name: Formatter
class.summary: Text formatter engine class.
class.description: Text formatter engine class. This class is used to apply formats like bold, italic, font size etc to the current selection or specific nodes. This engine was build to replace the browsers default formatting logic for execCommand due to it's inconsistant and buggy behavior.

method.name: get
method.summary: Returns the format by name or all formats if no name is specified.
method.description: Returns the format by name or all formats if no name is specified.

param.name: name
param.description: Optional name to retrive by.

return.description: Array/Object with all registred formats or a specific format.

method.name: register
method.summary: Registers a specific format by name.
method.description: Registers a specific format by name.

param.name: name
param.description: Name of the format for example "bold".

param.name: format
param.description: Optional format object or array of format variants can only be omitted if the first arg is an object.

method.name: apply
method.summary: Applies the specified format to the current selection or specified node.
method.description: Applies the specified format to the current selection or specified node.

param.name: name
param.description: Name of format to apply.

param.name: vars
param.description: Optional list of variables to replace within format before applying it.

param.name: node
param.description: Optional node to apply the format to defaults to current selection.

method.name: remove
method.summary: Removes the specified format from the current selection or specified node.
method.description: Removes the specified format from the current selection or specified node.

param.name: name
param.description: Name of format to remove.

param.name: vars
param.description: Optional list of variables to replace within format before removing it.

param.name: node
param.description: Optional node or DOM range to remove the format from defaults to current selection.

method.name: toggle
method.summary: Toggles the specified format on/off.
method.description: Toggles the specified format on/off.

param.name: name
param.description: Name of format to apply/remove.

param.name: vars
param.description: Optional list of variables to replace within format before applying/removing it.

param.name: node
param.description: Optional node to apply the format to or remove from. Defaults to current selection.

method.name: matchNode
method.summary: Return true/false if the specified node has the specified format.
method.description: Return true/false if the specified node has the specified format.

param.name: node
param.description: Node to check the format on.

param.name: name
param.description: Format name to check.

param.name: vars
param.description: Optional list of variables to replace before checking it.

param.name: similar
param.description: Match format that has similar properties.

return.description: Returns the format object it matches or undefined if it doesn't match.

method.name: match
method.summary: Matches the current selection or specified node against the specified format name.
method.description: Matches the current selection or specified node against the specified format name.

param.name: name
param.description: Name of format to match.

param.name: vars
param.description: Optional list of variables to replace before checking it.

param.name: node
param.description: Optional node to check.

return.description: true/false if the specified selection/node matches the format.

method.name: matchAll
method.summary: Matches the current selection against the array of formats and returns a new array with matching formats.
method.description: Matches the current selection against the array of formats and returns a new array with matching formats.

param.name: names
param.description: Name of format to match.

param.name: vars
param.description: Optional list of variables to replace before checking it.

return.description: Array with matched formats.

method.name: canApply
method.summary: Returns true/false if the specified format can be applied to the current selection or not.
method.description: Returns true/false if the specified format can be applied to the current selection or not. It will currently only check the state for selector formats, it returns true on all other format types.

param.name: name
param.description: Name of format to check.

return.description: true/false if the specified format can be applied to the current selection/node.

class.name: UndoManager
class.summary: This class handles the undo/redo history levels for the editor.
class.description: This class handles the undo/redo history levels for the editor. Since the build in undo/redo has major drawbacks a custom one was needed.

event.name: onAdd
event.summary: This event will fire each time a new undo level is added to the undo manager.
event.description: This event will fire each time a new undo level is added to the undo manager.

param.name: sender
param.description: UndoManager instance that got the new level.

param.name: level
param.description: The new level object containing a bookmark and contents.

event.name: onUndo
event.summary: This event will fire when the user make an undo of a change.
event.description: This event will fire when the user make an undo of a change.

param.name: sender
param.description: UndoManager instance that got the new level.

param.name: level
param.description: The old level object containing a bookmark and contents.

event.name: onRedo
event.summary: This event will fire when the user make an redo of a change.
event.description: This event will fire when the user make an redo of a change.

param.name: sender
param.description: UndoManager instance that got the new level.

param.name: level
param.description: The old level object containing a bookmark and contents.

method.name: beforeChange
method.summary: Stores away a bookmark to be used when performing an undo action so that the selection is before the change has been mad...
method.description: Stores away a bookmark to be used when performing an undo action so that the selection is before the change has been made.

method.name: add
method.summary: Adds a new undo level/snapshot to the undo list.
method.description: Adds a new undo level/snapshot to the undo list.

param.name: l
param.description: Optional undo level object to add.

return.description: Undo level that got added or null it a level wasn't needed.

method.name: undo
method.summary: Undoes the last action.
method.description: Undoes the last action.

return.description: Undo level or null if no undo was performed.

method.name: redo
method.summary: Redoes the last action.
method.description: Redoes the last action.

return.description: Redo level or null if no redo was performed.

method.name: clear
method.summary: Removes all undo levels.
method.description: Removes all undo levels.

method.name: hasUndo
method.summary: Returns true/false if the undo manager has any undo levels.
method.description: Returns true/false if the undo manager has any undo levels.

return.description: true/false if the undo manager has any undo levels.

method.name: hasRedo
method.summary: Returns true/false if the undo manager has any redo levels.
method.description: Returns true/false if the undo manager has any redo levels.

return.description: true/false if the undo manager has any redo levels.

class.name: WindowManager
class.summary: This class handles the creation of native windows and dialogs.
class.description: This class handles the creation of native windows and dialogs. This class can be extended to provide for example inline dialogs.

method.name: WindowManager
method.summary: Constructs a new window manager instance.
method.description: Constructs a new window manager instance.

param.name: ed
param.description: Editor instance that the windows are bound to.

method.name: open
method.summary: Opens a new window.
method.description: Opens a new window.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional name/value settings collection contains things like width/height/url etc.

option.name: title
option.description: Window title.

option.name: file
option.description: URL of the file to open in the window.

option.name: width
option.description: Width in pixels.

option.name: height
option.description: Height in pixels.

option.name: resizable
option.description: Specifies whether the popup window is resizable or not.

option.name: maximizable
option.description: Specifies whether the popup window has a "maximize" button and can get maximized or not.

option.name: inline
option.description: Specifies whether to display in-line (set to 1 or true for in-line display; requires inlinepopups plugin).

option.name: popup_css
option.description: Optional CSS to use in the popup. Set to false to remove the default one.

option.name: translate_i18n
option.description: Specifies whether translation should occur or not of i18 key strings. Default is true.

option.name: close_previous
option.description: Specifies whether a previously opened popup window is to be closed or not (like when calling the file browser window over the advlink popup).

option.name: scrollbars
option.description: Specifies whether the popup window can have scrollbars if required (i.e. content larger than the popup size specified).

param.name: p
param.description: Optional parameters/arguments collection can be used by the dialogs to retrive custom parameters.

option.name: plugin_url
option.description: url to plugin if opening plugin window that calls tinyMCEPopup.requireLangPack() and needs access to the plugin language js files

method.name: close
method.summary: Closes the specified window.
method.description: Closes the specified window. This will also dispatch out a onClose event.

param.name: w
param.description: Native window object to close.

method.name: createInstance
method.summary: Creates a instance of a class.
method.description: Creates a instance of a class. This method was needed since IE can't create instances of classes from a parent window due to some reference problem. Any arguments passed after the class name will be passed as arguments to the constructor.

param.name: cl
param.description: Class name to create an instance of.

return.description: Instance of the specified class.

method.example: var uri = tinyMCEPopup.editor.windowManager.createInstance('tinymce.util.URI', 'http://www.somesite.com'); alert(uri.getURI());

method.name: confirm
method.summary: Creates a confirm dialog.
method.description: Creates a confirm dialog. Please don't use the blocking behavior of this native version use the callback method instead then it can be extended.

param.name: t
param.description: Title for the new confirm dialog.

param.name: cb
param.description: Callback function to be executed after the user has selected ok or cancel.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional scope to execute the callback in.

method.name: alert
method.summary: Creates a alert dialog.
method.description: Creates a alert dialog. Please don't use the blocking behavior of this native version use the callback method instead then it can be extended.

param.name: t
param.description: Title for the new alert dialog.

param.name: cb
param.description: Callback function to be executed after the user has selected ok.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional scope to execute the callback in.

method.example: // Displays an alert box using the active editors window manager instance tinyMCE.activeEditor.windowManager.alert('Hello world!');

namespace.name: dom
namespace.description: Contains classes for handling the browsers DOM.

class.name: DOMUtils
class.summary: Utility class for various DOM manipulation and retrival functions.
class.description: Utility class for various DOM manipulation and retrival functions.

method.name: DOMUtils
method.summary: Constructs a new DOMUtils instance.
method.description: Constructs a new DOMUtils instance. Consult the Wiki for more details on settings etc for this class.

param.name: d
param.description: Document reference to bind the utility class to.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional settings collection.

method.name: isBlock
method.summary: Returns true/false if the specified element is a block element or not.
method.description: Returns true/false if the specified element is a block element or not.

param.name: node
param.description: Element/Node to check.

return.description: True/False state if the node is a block element or not.

method.name: getRoot
method.summary: Returns the root node of the document this is normally the body but might be a DIV.
method.description: Returns the root node of the document this is normally the body but might be a DIV. Parents like getParent will not go above the point of this root node.

return.description: Root element for the utility class.

method.name: getViewPort
method.summary: Returns the viewport of the window.
method.description: Returns the viewport of the window.

param.name: w
param.description: Optional window to get viewport of.

return.description: Viewport object with fields x, y, w and h.

method.name: getRect
method.summary: Returns the rectangle for a specific element.
method.description: Returns the rectangle for a specific element.

param.name: e
param.description: Element object or element ID to get rectange from.

return.description: Rectange for specified element object with x, y, w, h fields.

method.name: getSize
method.summary: Returns the size dimensions of the specified element.
method.description: Returns the size dimensions of the specified element.

param.name: e
param.description: Element object or element ID to get rectange from.

return.description: Rectange for specified element object with w, h fields.

method.name: getParent
method.summary: Returns a node by the specified selector function.
method.description: Returns a node by the specified selector function. This function will loop through all parent nodes and call the specified function for each node. If the function then returns true indicating that it has found what it was looking for, the loop execution will then end and the node it found will be returned.

param.name: n
param.description: DOM node to search parents on or ID string.

param.name: f
param.description: Selection function to execute on each node or CSS pattern.

param.name: r
param.description: Optional root element, never go below this point.

return.description: DOM Node or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: getParents
method.summary: Returns a node list of all parents matching the specified selector function or pattern.
method.description: Returns a node list of all parents matching the specified selector function or pattern. If the function then returns true indicating that it has found what it was looking for and that node will be collected.

param.name: n
param.description: DOM node to search parents on or ID string.

param.name: f
param.description: Selection function to execute on each node or CSS pattern.

param.name: r
param.description: Optional root element, never go below this point.

return.description: Array of nodes or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: get
method.summary: Returns the specified element by ID or the input element if it isn't a string.
method.description: Returns the specified element by ID or the input element if it isn't a string.

param.name: n
param.description: Element id to look for or element to just pass though.

return.description: Element matching the specified id or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: getNext
method.summary: Returns the next node that matches selector or function
method.description: Returns the next node that matches selector or function

param.name: node
param.description: Node to find siblings from.

param.name: selector
param.description: Selector CSS expression or function.

return.description: Next node item matching the selector or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: getPrev
method.summary: Returns the previous node that matches selector or function
method.description: Returns the previous node that matches selector or function

param.name: node
param.description: Node to find siblings from.

param.name: selector
param.description: Selector CSS expression or function.

return.description: Previous node item matching the selector or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: select
method.summary: Selects specific elements by a CSS level 3 pattern.
method.description: Selects specific elements by a CSS level 3 pattern. For example "div#a1 p.test". This function is optimized for the most common patterns needed in TinyMCE but it also performes good enough on more complex patterns.

param.name: p
param.description: CSS level 1 pattern to select/find elements by.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional root element/scope element to search in.

return.description: Array with all matched elements.

method.name: is
method.summary: Returns true/false if the specified element matches the specified css pattern.
method.description: Returns true/false if the specified element matches the specified css pattern.

param.name: n
param.description: DOM node to match or an array of nodes to match.

param.name: selector
param.description: CSS pattern to match the element agains.

method.name: add
method.summary: Adds the specified element to another element or elements.
method.description: Adds the specified element to another element or elements.

param.name: Element
param.description: id string, DOM node element or array of id's or elements to add to.

param.name: n
param.description: Name of new element to add or existing element to add.

param.name: a
param.description: Optional object collection with arguments to add to the new element(s).

param.name: h
param.description: Optional inner HTML contents to add for each element.

param.name: c
param.description: Optional internal state to indicate if it should create or add.

return.description: Element that got created or array with elements if multiple elements where passed.

method.example: // Adds a new paragraph to the end of the active editor tinyMCE.activeEditor.dom.add(tinyMCE.activeEditor.getBody(), 'p', {title : 'my title'}, 'Some content');

method.name: create
method.summary: Creates a new element.
method.description: Creates a new element.

param.name: n
param.description: Name of new element.

param.name: a
param.description: Optional object name/value collection with element attributes.

param.name: h
param.description: Optional HTML string to set as inner HTML of the element.

return.description: HTML DOM node element that got created.

method.name: createHTML
method.summary: Create HTML string for element.
method.description: Create HTML string for element. The element will be closed unless an empty inner HTML string is passed.

param.name: n
param.description: Name of new element.

param.name: a
param.description: Optional object name/value collection with element attributes.

param.name: h
param.description: Optional HTML string to set as inner HTML of the element.

return.description: String with new HTML element like for example: test.

method.example: // Creates a html chunk and inserts it at the current selection/caret location tinyMCE.activeEditor.selection.setContent(tinyMCE.activeEditor.dom.createHTML('a', {href : 'test.html'}, 'some line'));

method.name: remove
method.summary: Removes/deletes the specified element(s) from the DOM.
method.description: Removes/deletes the specified element(s) from the DOM.

param.name: node
param.description: ID of element or DOM element object or array containing multiple elements/ids.

param.name: keep_children
param.description: Optional state to keep children or not. If set to true all children will be placed at the location of the removed element.

return.description: HTML DOM element that got removed or array of elements depending on input.

method.name: setStyle
method.summary: Sets the CSS style value on a HTML element.
method.description: Sets the CSS style value on a HTML element. The name can be a camelcase string or the CSS style name like background-color.

param.name: n
param.description: HTML element/Element ID or Array of elements/ids to set CSS style value on.

param.name: na
param.description: Name of the style value to set.

param.name: v
param.description: Value to set on the style.

method.name: getStyle
method.summary: Returns the current style or runtime/computed value of a element.

method.name: split
method.summary: Splits an element into two new elements and places the specified split element or element between the new ones.
method.description:
Splits an element into two new elements and places the specified split element or element between the new ones. For example splitting the paragraph at the bold element in this example

abcabc123

would produce

abc

abc

123

.

param.description: Parent element to split.

param.name: e
param.description: Element to split at.

param.name: re
param.description: Optional replacement element to replace the split element by.

return.description: Returns the split element or the replacement element if that is specified.

class.name: Element
class.summary: Element class, this enables element blocking in IE.
class.description: Element class, this enables element blocking in IE. Element blocking is a method to block out select blockes that gets visible though DIVs on IE 6 it uses a iframe for this blocking. This class also shortens the length of some DOM API calls since it's bound to an element.

class.name: ScriptLoader
class.summary: This class handles asynchronous/synchronous loading of JavaScript files it will execute callbacks when various items get...
class.description: This class handles asynchronous/synchronous loading of JavaScript files it will execute callbacks when various items gets loaded. This class is useful to load external JavaScript files.

method.name: load

method.description: Loads a specific script directly without adding it to the load queue.

param.description: Absolute URL to the script to mark as loaded.

param.name: scope
param.description: Optional scope to execute callback in.

class.name: Selection
class.summary: This class handles text and control selection it's an crossbrowser utility class.
class.description: This class handles text and control selection it's an crossbrowser utility class. Consult the TinyMCE Wiki API for more details and examples on how to use this class.
class.example: // Getting the currently selected node for the active editor alert(tinymce.activeEditor.selection.getNode().nodeName);

method.name: Selection
method.summary: Constructs a new selection instance.
method.description: Constructs a new selection instance.

param.name: dom
param.description: DOMUtils object reference.

param.name: win
param.description: Window to bind the selection object to.

param.name: serializer
param.description: DOM serialization class to use for getContent.

event.name: onBeforeSetContent
event.summary: This event gets executed before contents is extracted from the selection.
event.description: This event gets executed before contents is extracted from the selection.

param.name: selection
param.description: Selection object that fired the event.

param.name: args
param.description: Contains things like the contents that will be returned.

event.name: onBeforeGetContent
event.summary: This event gets executed before contents is inserted into selection.
event.description: This event gets executed before contents is inserted into selection.

param.name: selection
param.description: Selection object that fired the event.

param.name: args
param.description: Contains things like the contents that will be inserted.

event.name: onSetContent
event.summary: This event gets executed when contents is inserted into selection.
event.description: This event gets executed when contents is inserted into selection.

param.name: selection
param.description: Selection object that fired the event.

param.name: args
param.description: Contains things like the contents that will be inserted.

event.name: onGetContent
event.summary: This event gets executed when contents is extracted from the selection.
event.description: This event gets executed when contents is extracted from the selection.

param.name: selection
param.description: Selection object that fired the event.

param.name: args
param.description: Contains things like the contents that will be returned.

method.name: getContent
method.summary: Returns the selected contents using the DOM serializer passed in to this class.
method.description: Returns the selected contents using the DOM serializer passed in to this class.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional settings class with for example output format text or html.

return.description: Selected contents in for example HTML format.

method.name: setContent
method.summary: Sets the current selection to the specified content.
method.description: Sets the current selection to the specified content. If any contents is selected it will be replaced with the contents passed in to this function. If there is no selection the contents will be inserted where the caret is placed in the editor/page.

param.name: content
param.description: HTML contents to set could also be other formats depending on settings.

param.name: args
param.description: Optional settings object with for example data format.

method.example: // Inserts some HTML contents at the current selection tinyMCE.activeEditor.selection.setContent('Some contents');

method.name: getStart
method.summary: Returns the start element of a selection range.
method.description: Returns the start element of a selection range. If the start is in a text node the parent element will be returned.

return.description: Start element of selection range.

method.name: getEnd
method.summary: Returns the end element of a selection range.
method.description: Returns the end element of a selection range. If the end is in a text node the parent element will be returned.

return.description: End element of selection range.

method.name: getBookmark
method.summary: Returns a bookmark location for the current selection.
method.description: Returns a bookmark location for the current selection. This bookmark object can then be used to restore the selection after some content modification to the document.

param.name: type
param.description: Optional state if the bookmark should be simple or not. Default is complex.

param.name: normalized
param.description: Optional state that enables you to get a position that it would be after normalization.

return.description: Bookmark object, use moveToBookmark with this object to restore the selection.

method.name: moveToBookmark
method.summary: Restores the selection to the specified bookmark.
method.description: Restores the selection to the specified bookmark.

param.name: bookmark
param.description: Bookmark to restore selection from.

return.description: true/false if it was successful or not.

method.name: select
method.summary: Selects the specified element.
method.description: Selects the specified element. This will place the start and end of the selection range around the element.

param.name: node
param.description: HMTL DOM element to select.

param.name: content
param.description: Optional bool state if the contents should be selected or not on non IE browser.

return.description: Selected element the same element as the one that got passed in.

method.example: // Select the first paragraph in the active editor tinyMCE.activeEditor.selection.select(tinyMCE.activeEditor.dom.select('p')[0]);

method.name: isCollapsed
method.summary: Returns true/false if the selection range is collapsed or not.
method.description: Returns true/false if the selection range is collapsed or not. Collapsed means if it's a caret or a larger selection.

return.description: true/false state if the selection range is collapsed or not. Collapsed means if it's a caret or a larger selection.

method.name: collapse
method.summary: Collapse the selection to start or end of range.
method.description: Collapse the selection to start or end of range.

param.name: to_start
param.description: Optional boolean state if to collapse to end or not. Defaults to start.

method.name: getSel
method.summary: Returns the browsers internal selection object.
method.description: Returns the browsers internal selection object.

return.description: Internal browser selection object.

method.name: getRng
method.summary: Returns the browsers internal range object.
method.description: Returns the browsers internal range object.

param.name: w3c
param.description: Forces a compatible W3C range on IE.

return.description: Internal browser range object.

method.name: setRng
method.summary: Changes the selection to the specified DOM range.
method.description: Changes the selection to the specified DOM range.

param.name: r
param.description: Range to select.

method.name: setNode
method.summary: Sets the current selection to the specified DOM element.
method.description: Sets the current selection to the specified DOM element.

param.name: n
param.description: Element to set as the contents of the selection.

return.description: Returns the element that got passed in.

method.example: // Inserts a DOM node at current selection/caret location tinyMCE.activeEditor.selection.setNode(tinyMCE.activeEditor.dom.create('img', {src : 'some.gif', title : 'some title'}));

method.name: getNode
method.summary: Returns the currently selected element or the common ancestor element for both start and end of the selection.
method.description: Returns the currently selected element or the common ancestor element for both start and end of the selection.

return.description: Currently selected element or common ancestor element.

method.example: // Alerts the currently selected elements node name alert(tinyMCE.activeEditor.selection.getNode().nodeName);

class.name: Serializer
class.summary: This class is used to serialize DOM trees into a string.
class.description: This class is used to serialize DOM trees into a string. Consult the TinyMCE Wiki API for more details and examples on how to use this class.

method.name: Serializer
method.summary: Constucts a new DOM serializer class.
method.description: Constucts a new DOM serializer class.

param.name: settings
param.description: Serializer settings object.

param.name: dom
param.description: DOMUtils instance reference.

param.name: schema
param.description: Optional schema reference.

event.name: onPreProcess
event.summary: This event gets executed before a HTML fragment gets serialized into a HTML string.
event.description: This event gets executed before a HTML fragment gets serialized into a HTML string. This event enables you to do modifications to the DOM before the serialization occurs. It's important to know that the element that is getting serialized is cloned so it's not inside a document.

param.name: sender
param.description: object/Serializer instance that is serializing an element.

param.name: args
param.description: Object containing things like the current node.

event.name: onPreProcess
event.summary: This event gets executed after a HTML fragment has been serialized into a HTML string.
event.description: This event gets executed after a HTML fragment has been serialized into a HTML string. This event enables you to do modifications to the HTML string like regexp replaces etc.

param.name: sender
param.description: object/Serializer instance that is serializing an element.

param.name: args
param.description: Object containing things like the current contents.

method.name: addNodeFilter
method.summary: Adds a node filter function to the parser used by the serializer, the parser will collect the specified nodes by name an...
method.description: Adds a node filter function to the parser used by the serializer, the parser will collect the specified nodes by name and then execute the callback ones it has finished parsing the document.

param.name: callback
param.description: Callback function to execute once it has collected nodes.

method.name: addAttributeFilter
method.summary: Adds a attribute filter function to the parser used by the serializer, the parser will collect nodes that has the specif...
method.description: Adds a attribute filter function to the parser used by the serializer, the parser will collect nodes that has the specified attributes and then execute the callback ones it has finished parsing the document.

param.name: callback
param.description: Callback function to execute once it has collected nodes.

event.name: onPreProcess
event.summary: Fires when the Serializer does a preProcess on the contents.
event.description: Fires when the Serializer does a preProcess on the contents.

param.name: sender
param.description: Editor instance.

param.name: obj
param.description: PreProcess object.

option.name: node
option.description: DOM node for the item being serialized.

option.name: format
option.description: The specified output format normally "html".

option.name: get
option.description: Is true if the process is on a getContent operation.

option.name: set
option.description: Is true if the process is on a setContent operation.

option.name: cleanup

class.name: DomParser
class.summary: This class parses HTML code into a DOM like structure of nodes it will remove redundant whitespace and make sure that th...
class.description:
This class parses HTML code into a DOM like structure of nodes it will remove redundant whitespace and make sure that the node tree is valid according to the specified schema. So for example:

a

b

c

will become

a

b

c
class.example:
var parser = new tinymce.html.DomParser({validate: true}, schema); var rootNode = parser.parse('

content

');

class.name: SaxParser

method.name: encodeRaw

param.description: Text to encode.

param.description: Optional flag to specify if the text is attribute contents.

return.description: Entity encoded text.

method.name: encodeAllRaw
method.summary: Encoded the specified text with both the attributes and text entities.
method.description: Encoded the specified text with both the attributes and text entities. This function will produce larger text contents since it doesn't know if the context is within a attribute or text node. This was added for compatibility and is exposed as the DOMUtils.encode function.

param.name: text
param.description: Text to encode.

return.description: Entity encoded text.

method.name: encodeNumeric
method.summary: Encodes the specified string using numeric entities.
method.description: Encodes the specified string using numeric entities. The core entities will be encoded as named ones but all non lower ascii characters will be encoded into numeric entities.

param.name: text
param.description: Text to encode.

param.name: attr
param.description: Optional flag to specify if the text is attribute contents.

return.description: Entity encoded text.

method.name: encodeNamed
method.summary: Encodes the specified string using named entities.
method.description: Encodes the specified string using named entities. The core entities will be encoded as named ones but all non lower ascii characters will be encoded into named entities.

param.name: text
param.description: Text to encode.

param.name: attr
param.description: Optional flag to specify if the text is attribute contents.

param.name: entities
param.description: Optional parameter with entities to use.

return.description: Entity encoded text.

method.description: Returns an encode function based on the name(s) and it's optional entities.

param.name: name
param.description: Comma separated list of encoders for example named,numeric.

param.name: entities
param.description: Optional parameter with entities to use instead of the built in set.

return.description: Encode function to be used.

method.name: makeMap
method.summary: Makes a name/object map out of an array with names.
method.description: Makes a name/object map out of an array with names.

param.name: items
param.description: Items to make map out of.

param.name: delim
param.description: Optional delimiter to split string by.

param.name: map
param.description: Optional map to add items to.

return.description: Name/value map of items.

method.name: each
method.summary: Performs an iteration of all items in a collection such as an object or array.
method.description: Performs an iteration of all items in a collection such as an object or array. This method will execure the callback function for each item in the collection, if the callback returns false the iteration will terminate. The callback has the following format: cb(value, key_or_index).

param.name: o
param.description: Collection to iterate.

param.name: cb
param.description: Callback function to execute for each item.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional scope to execute the callback in.

method.name: map
method.summary: Creates a new array by the return value of each iteration function call.
method.description: Creates a new array by the return value of each iteration function call. This enables you to convert one array list into another.

param.name: a
param.description: Array of items to iterate.

param.name: f
param.description: Function to call for each item. It's return value will be the new value.

return.description: Array with new values based on function return values.

method.name: grep
method.summary: Filters out items from the input array by calling the specified function for each item.
method.description: Filters out items from the input array by calling the specified function for each item. If the function returns false the item will be excluded if it returns true it will be included.

param.name: a
param.description: Array of items to loop though.

param.name: f
param.description: Function to call for each item. Include/exclude depends on it's return value.

return.description: New array with values imported and filtered based in input.

method.example: // Filter out some items, this will return an array with 4 and 5 var items = tinymce.grep([1,2,3,4,5], function(v) {return v > 3;});

method.name: inArray
method.summary: Returns the index of a value in an array, this method will return -1 if the item wasn't found.
method.description: Returns the index of a value in an array, this method will return -1 if the item wasn't found.

param.name: a
param.description: Array/Object to search for value in.

param.name: v
param.description: Value to check for inside the array.

return.description: Index of item inside the array inside an object. Or -1 if it wasn't found.

method.example: // Get index of value in array this will alert 1 since 2 is at that index alert(tinymce.inArray([1,2,3], 2));

method.name: extend
method.summary: Extends an object with the specified other object(s).
method.description: Extends an object with the specified other object(s).

param.name: o
param.description: Object to extend with new items.

param.name: e..n
param.description: Object(s) to extend the specified object with.

return.description: o New extended object, same reference as the input object.

method.description: Removes whitespace from the beginning and end of a string.

param.description: String to remove whitespace from.

return.description: New string with removed whitespace.

param.description: Object tree to walk though.

method.summary: Creates a namespace on a specific object.
method.description: Creates a namespace on a specific object.

param.name: o
param.description: Optional object to add namespace to, defaults to window.

method.name: resolve
method.summary: Resolves a string and returns the object from a specific structure.
method.description: Resolves a string and returns the object from a specific structure.

param.name: n
param.description: Path to resolve for example a.b.c.d.

param.name: o
param.description: Optional object to search though, defaults to window.

return.description: Last object in path or null if it couldn't be resolved.

method.example: // Resolve a path into an object reference var obj = tinymce.resolve('a.b.c.d');

method.name: addUnload
method.summary: Adds an unload handler to the document.
method.description: Adds an unload handler to the document. This handler will be executed when the document gets unloaded. This method is useful for dealing with browser memory leaks where it might be vital to remove DOM references etc.

param.name: f
param.description: Function to execute before the document gets unloaded.

param.name: s
param.description: Optional scope to execute the function in.

return.description: Returns the specified unload handler function.

method.name: removeUnload
method.summary: Removes the specified function form the unload handler list.
method.description: Removes the specified function form the unload handler list.

param.name: f
param.description: Function to remove from unload handler list.

return.description: Removed function name or null if it wasn't found.

method.name: explode
method.summary: Splits a string but removes the whitespace before and after each value.
method.description: Splits a string but removes the whitespace before and after each value.

param.name: s
param.description: String to split.

param.name: d
param.description: Delimiter to split by.

method.example: // Split a string into an array with a,b,c var arr = tinymce.explode('a, b, c');

class.name: tinyMCEPopup
class.summary: TinyMCE popup/dialog helper class.

method.summary: Resizes the dialog to the inner size of the window.
method.description: Resizes the dialog to the inner size of the window. This is needed since various browsers have different border sizes on windows.

method.description: Will executed the specified string when the page has been loaded. This function was added for compatibility with the 2.x branch.

param.name: s

method.name: storeSelection
method.summary: Stores the current editor selection for later restoration.
method.description: Stores the current editor selection for later restoration. This can be useful since some browsers looses it's selection if a control element is selected/focused inside the dialogs.

method.name: restoreSelection
method.summary: Restores any stored selection.
method.description: Restores any stored selection. This can be useful since some browsers looses it's selection if a control element is selected/focused inside the dialogs.

method.name: requireLangPack
method.summary: Loads a specific dialog language pack.
method.description: Loads a specific dialog language pack. If you pass in plugin_url as a arugment when you open the window it will load the <plugin url>/langs/<code>_dlg.js lang pack file.

param.name: element_id
param.description: Element id to be filled with the color value from the picker.

param.name: type

param.name: option
param.description: Option name to get the file_broswer_callback function name from.
